video.title: Web3 Course Walkthrough on freeCodeCamp.org (Rust, Blockchain Development, and Smart Contracts)
video.description:
We just released the beta version of our new Web3 curriculum on freeCodeCamp.org. In this video, freeCodeCamp software engineers Tom and Shaun will walk you through some of the new Web3 curriculum projects.

🔗 Learn more: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/web3-curriculum-open-beta/
🔗 Access the Web3 curriculum: https://web3.freecodecamp.org/web3

topLevelComment.author: Ruqylicious Foods
topLevelComment.text:
Well-done guys.
Pls am a newbie in tech and I would like to b a UI/ UX designer/ product designer as I was told it will b easier to learn as a complete beginner in techworld.
Please please, I like the way u guys teach and I don't mind if you can put me through in the lessons/ courses.
And every other practical aspect to becoming a good product designer inorder to secure a good job.
Thanks.
Awaiting ur reply .

replies.author: mionee_m
replies.text: look up professionals on your interest and find book and resource recommendations from their blogs/twitters etc., read books on topics, follow examples, make personal changes and experiment, Save results, put time into thinking of, going back, and finding out ways to connect your work, produce snippets and demos. a personal touch will arise from your work as long as you do it for long enough and avoid mindlessness. Don't be lazy, take breaks and humble yourself to a progressing personal pace and never give up. If you lose interest in a project drop it for a reason and catch your own excuses to find self-sustaining personal accountability. and so on. good luck

replies.author: Humble_energy
replies.text: learn UX design theories, UI design concepts like color and typography, figma, adobe ps, ai, xd, languages like html, css including SASS n bootstrap, and some javascript. Good luck to you from another UX/UI designer.

topLevelComment.author: The Data Armory
topLevelComment.text:
Great and  detailed as always. All serious visual learners must appreciate that  the quality of a course is much more important than the length. It would rather be  long but  of QUALITY.

Observation : As a teacher ,  I believe that the FONT or ZOOM level of the editor should always be BIGGER so that ACTIVE LEARNERS (those who practically CODE along) will have no trouble seeing the code.
